moves.1. e3 c5 2. Qh5: White brings out his Q too early.
moves.2... d5 3. Bb5+ Bd7 4. Qe2 Nf6 5. Bxd7+: White has no developed pieces; black contains the advantage of space, piece development, and since white must expend extra time to piece development to catch up, black has the initiative as well.
moves.8. d4 c4 9. c3 Nfd7 10. b3 e6 11. Nf3 Bd: with no Qs on the board, and almost all of the pawns still present, it's (relatively) safe for black to advance his K.
White mistakenly trades off his only mate-giving piece.
from here black has little trouble mating white with his N and Q.
